business.headline: India, US eyeing interim trade deal by June-end? Inside the closed-door talksBoth nations are aiming for an interim trade pact by the end of June, before the pause on Trump's proposed tariffs expires. India is advocating for full exemption from a 26% reciprocal tariff on domestic goods.

Stock market opening: Will Sensex, Nifty open higher today? Check key levelsSensex and Nifty closed flat on Tuesday, ending a four-day winning streak. The flat close was largely due to profit booking, especially in financial stocks.
Stocks to watch on June 11: Wipro, Reliance Infra, IndiGo, Maruti SuzukiExperts suggest that the positive sentiment is likely to persist on Dalal Street with the key support level of Nifty at 24,850.

World Bank slashes global growth forecast, cites higher tariffs and uncertaintyIn its twice-yearly Global Economic Prospects report, the bank lowered its forecasts for nearly 70 per cent of all economies as well as six emerging market regions, from the levels it projected just six months ago before US President Donald Trump took office.

Applying for a personal loan? How many years of ITRs do you needBanks need to be sure you can pay back the money you borrow. For salaried individuals, a regular pay cheque and Form 16 usually provide enough assurance. However, for self-employed individuals, ITRs over several years give a more consistent and reliable picture of earnings and financial health.
Raymond Realty likely to list in early July, says chairman Gautam SinghaniaEach shareholder will receive one share of Raymond Realty for every share held in Raymond, the group said previously.

Sensex, Nifty end flat as profit booking halts rally; IT gains capped by banksThe S&P BSE Sensex was down by 53.49 points to end at 82,391.72, while the NSE Nifty50 ended flat with a gain of 1 point to 25,104.25.

Mutual fund inflows fall: Should beginners still trust SIPs or go for stocks?Data from the Association of Mutual Funds in India (AMFI) shows that net inflows into equity schemes dropped 22% month-on-month to Rs 19,013 crore in May, marking the fifth straight month of decline and the weakest level since April 2024.

India emerges as Apple's new bet, but China and Trump raise red flags: ReportLast week, Foxconn announced a fresh $1.5 billion investment in its Indian operations, offering some reassurance to officials in New Delhi. This move may ease tensions in New Delhi that began when Donald Trump publicly stated he told Tim Cook not to expand Apple's manufacturing in India, casting doubt on hopes that most iPhones for the US would be made in India by 2026.
Filing under old tax regime? New ITR rules you should know in 2025Key changes in the Income Tax Return (ITR) filing process for those opting for the old tax regime in the Assessment Year 2025–26.

Rupee stuck in neutral as Asia's currencies race ahead on weak dollarWhile the Singapore dollar, Korean won, and Taiwanese dollar have jumped between 6% and 9.5% so far this year, the rupee has barely moved.

Mutual fund SIPs continue strong run, touch Rs 26,688 crore in May: AMFIMutual fund SIPs reached a fresh high of Rs 26,688 crore in May, inching up from Rs 26,632 crore the previous month, as per AMFI data released on June 10.

entertainment.headline: Vairamuthu is a good poet, not good human: Tamil composer backs singer ChinmayiVeteran Tamil composer Gangai Amaran came out in support of singer Chinmayi Sripada. Referring to her sexual misconduct accusations against lyricist Vairamuthu, Amaran said that we should stand by the woman.

Malta International Arts Festival brings 10 days of music, dance & cultureThe Malta International Arts Festival returns June 13–22 with music, dance, theatre, and visual art performances across iconic venues, featuring both international and local talent in immersive cultural settings.

Turnstile drops new album and announces 2025 Tour across US Turnstile has announced a 2025 US tour following the release of NEVER ENOUGH. The band will perform across major cities, with support from top acts and festival appearances.

Diddy's ex confesses love amidst shocking abuse allegationsAn ex-girlfriend of Sean "Diddy" Combs testified at his sex trafficking trial, saying she still loves him despite alleging abuse and coercion.

Enrique Iglesias to perform in Mumbai in October: When and where to book ticketsGlobal pop icon Enrique Iglesias is set to perform in Mumbai after 13 years. Fans can book tickets starting June with special pre-sale offers for Mastercard holders.

Let bygones be bygones: Karan Johar on fallout and patch-up with Kartik AaryanFilmmaker Karan Johar reacted to his 2021 fallout with actor Kartik Aaryan. He reflected on sorting out differences and collaborating on their new romantic comedy 'Tu Meri Main Tera, Main Tera Tu Meri'.

Detective Sherdil trailer: Diljit Dosanjh is Sherlock in whodunnit set in BudapestActor Diljit Dosanjh is all set to play the titular role in 'Detective Sherdil' set in Budapest. The upcoming murder-mystery releasing on ZEE5 shows Diljit playing a sharp-witted detective.

Nagarjuna praises Rashmika: None of us have Rs 3000 crore films, she is the oneDuring the audio launch event of the third single from the film 'Kuberaa', which happened in Mumbai, veteran Telugu actor Nagarjuna showered praise on co-star Rashmika Mandanna.

Kamal Haasan wishes Shiva Rajkumar on 40 years in Kannada cinema after Thug Life row'Thug Life' actor Kamal Haasan wished veteran Kannada actor Shiva Rajkumar on stepping into 40th year in cinema. Both names were recently involved in a controversy when Kamal Haasan said that the language Kannada was born from Tamil.

Ram Charan to collaborate with director Trivikram for a family entertainer: ReportDirector Trivikram Srinivas, who last collaborated with Mahesh Babu for 'Guntur Kaaram', is yet to officially announce his next project. However, fresh reports suggest that he may team up with Ram Charan for a family entertainer.

Smriti Irani signs contract for Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi sequel: ReportActor-turned-politician Smriti Irani has reportedly signed the contract for the 'Kyunki Saas Kabhi Bhi Bahu Thi' sequel. She is reprising the iconic role of Tulsi Virani in the show, which is yet to be announced.

Sudha Murthy reviews Aamir's Sitaare Zameen Par, calls it cinematic tool for changeAuthor and philanthropist Sudha Murthy has shared the first review of the Aamir Khan starrer 'Sitaare Zameen Par'. She said the film is an eye-opener and has the potential to bring about meaningful change.

Dipika Kakar shares health update after 14-hour surgery for liver cancerActor Dipika Kakar has shared her health update on her husband Shoaib Ibrahim's recent YouTube vlog. Dipika underwent a 14-surgery after being diagnosed with stage 2 liver cancer.

Kunal Kapoor debuts sharp jawline in BTS pics from Ramayana, fans reactActor Kunal Kapoor is playing the role of Lord Indra in 'Ramayana', which also stars Ranbir Kapoor and Sai Pallavi as Lord Ram and Goddess Sita. Check out his latest behind-the-scenes pictures from the sets.

Amitabh Bachchan's folded-hands reply to X user's jibe at his age and longevityAmitabh Bachchan clapped back at a troll who tried to take a jibe at his age and sleep in the comment section of his post on X. Big B maintained grace and sarcasm as he responded to the social media user.

How director Tarun Mansukhani predicted Priyanka's global success with 'Desi Girl'Director Tarun Mansukhani fondly remembered the creation of the iconic song 'Desi Girl' and his rare, agenda-free friendship with Priyanka Chopra. He also revealed his heartfelt wish to visit and shoot in Kashmir, highlighting his love for India in an exclusive conversation with India Today.

Amol Parashar reacts to dating rumours with Konkana SensharmaActor Amol Parashar has addressed dating rumours involving his 'Dolly Kitty Aur Wo Chamakte Sitare' co-star Konkona Sensharma. Amol said that if he had any news to share, he would share it himself on his social media.

Varun Grover explains his 'no' comment on Anurag Kashyap's old love letter to VangaWriter and comedian Varun Grover wrote 'no' in the comments section when Anurag Kashyap dedicated a long note to Sandeep Reddy Vanga, calling him a 'misunderstood filmmaker'. He now clarified why he didn't agree with the post.

Navjot Sidhu welcomes Sultan of Sultans, Salman Khan, on Kapil Sharma's show. PicsNavjot Singh Sidhu recently shared some fun pictures from 'The Great Indian Kapil Show 3' ahead of its premiere. Actor Salman Khan will be seen as a special guest in one of the upcoming episodes.

general news.headline: Shubhanshu Shukla's Axiom-4 mission launch postponed due to liquid oxygen leakThe launch of the Axiom-4 (Ax-4) mission to the International Space Station (ISS) has been postponed, SpaceX confirmed. The delay comes after a liquid oxygen (LOx) leak was detected during post-static fire booster inspections. The Ax-4 mission is set to launch Indian astronaut Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla to the ISS.

LA imposes partial curfew amid protests, looting over Trump's immigration raidsAnnouncing the partial curfew, Mayor Karen Bass stated that the Los Angeles Police Department needed additional help -- but not from the Trump administration. She said the real solution to addressing the deteriorating law and order situation is for the Trump administration to 'stop the raids.'

Raja Raghuvanshi murder accused confess to crime, say wife watched killingThe accused told the police that Sonam was present on the spot when Raja Rahuvanshi was attacked and watched on as he was murdered.

Not Pak, it's India vs Terroristan: S Jaishankar's big attack on IslamabadSpeaking at a joint press conference with EU High Representative for Foreign Affairs and Security Policy, Kaja Kallas, S Jaishankar said the current situation should not be viewed as a conflict between two states, but as India's response to terrorism.

Trapped by tradition: Who killed Raja Raghuvanshi? Sonam or...?The tragic case of Raja Raghuvanshi, allegedly murdered by his wife Sonam in collusion with her lover, exposes the dark underbelly of India's marital system. This story isn't just about betrayal; it's a stark reminder of how India's obsession with family pride, caste, and tradition can eclipse individual choice, leading to devastating consequences

PM meets Op Sindoor delegates who took India's stand against terrorism globalPhotos from the meeting showed PM Modi engaging warmly with the delegation members, listening to their experiences as they took India's anti-terror message abroad.

Woman doctor assaulted after newborn's death, accused tried to strangle herThe assault on a female doctor at a Delhi government hospital by a patient's attendants following a newborn's death has sparked outrage, prompting citywide protests and a "Black Day" observance by the Delhi Medical Association.

Your new AC may not cool below 20°C. Here's whyUnion Minister of Housing and Urban Affairs Manohar Lal Khattar said that residential and commercial establishments, as well as vehicles, will soon have standardised AC temperature settings between 20°C and 28°C.

Watch: Masked looters hit Apple store, vandalise shops as LA protest turns chaoticA peaceful protest over immigration raids turned violent Monday night in downtown LA, as masked looters hit an Apple Store and several other shops. Police made arrests amid vandalism and clashes. Officials are calling for a curfew as tensions rise following days of protests.

How BJP flipped the script in a year. Explained in 5 pointsSilencing murmurs of a mid-term collapse, the BJP-led Narendra Modi 3.0 has turned the tables in one year after it took office in June 2024. In just 12 months, the BJP has won three key assembly polls, and has shown the will to push for major legislative overhauls, keeping allies content and intact. Operation Sindoor has proven to be the icing on the cake, which has galvanised sentiments and support for the Narendra Modi-led Centre.
Video: Passenger slaps Meghalaya honeymoon murder accused at Indore airportA passenger slapped an accused arrested in the Raja Raghuvanshi murder case at the Indore Airport on Tuesday night.

WTC final preview: South Africa chase respect and glory against mighty AussiesWTC 2025 final preview: South Africa eye a defining triumph as they battle for respect on Test cricket's grandest stage. Standing in their way: defending champions Australia, chasing an era-defining victory at Lord's, London.

Enrique Iglesias to perform in Mumbai in October: When and where to book ticketsGlobal pop icon Enrique Iglesias is set to perform in Mumbai after 13 years. Fans can book tickets starting June with special pre-sale offers for Mastercard holders.

Sonam told her family about lover before marrying Raja, warned...: Raja's brotherVipin Raghuwanshi, Raja's elder brother, told Aaj Tak, India Today's sister channel, that Sonam had confided in her mother about her relationship with Raj Kushwaha, the man now accused of plotting Raja's murder with her. But Sonam's family refused to accept the relationship, insisting that her marriage must happen within their community.

Will strike deep into Pak if provoked by terror attacks: Jaishankar's big warningExternal Affairs Minister S Jaishankar, who is travelling to Europe a month after India launched Operation Sindoor in response to the Pahalgam terror attack, warned retribution against terror outfits.

We'll liberate LA, Donald Trump tells soldiers, calls city a trash heapUS President Trump called Los Angeles a "trash heap" overrun by gangs, defending his deployment of troops to quell immigration protests. He vowed to "liberate" the city and restore order.

Vairamuthu is a good poet, not good human: Tamil composer backs singer ChinmayiVeteran Tamil composer Gangai Amaran came out in support of singer Chinmayi Sripada. Referring to her sexual misconduct accusations against lyricist Vairamuthu, Amaran said that we should stand by the woman.

Delhi University to offer new course on handling modern relationship issuesDelhi University has launched a new elective course, Negotiating Intimate Relationships, to help undergrads deal with love, red flags, dating apps, and relationship stress in the digital age.

Karnataka cabinet reshuffle on cards as Congress reviews key department rolesReportedly upset over the developments in Bengaluru, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi is said to be asking for a major reshuffle in Karnataka. Sources say DK Shivakumar and G Parameshwara may lose key portfolios.

China thanks India for rescuing crew of Singapore-flagged ship that caught fireSpokesperson of the Chinese Embassy in India, Yu Jing, thanked the Indian Navy and Mumbai Coast Guard for their prompt and professional rescue.
How the world can pressure Pakistan on terrorismCoercion, though indispensable in managing Pakistan, should be a means to an end, leveraged through dialogue

Meghalaya Chief Minister slams 'branding' of state, region after honeymoon murderConrad Sangma argued that the crime, though brutal and tragic, was being used to vilify the state, and the entire northeast region in general. He added that the people of the northeast were "hurt" and the region was being wrongly stigmatised.

Baba Siddique's murder mastermind Zeeshan Akhtar detained in CanadaZeeshan Akhtar is believed to be the mastermind behind the contract killing of Baba Siddique, who was shot dead in October last year.

5 Keralites killed in tourist bus accident in Kenya, several injuredFive Keralites have been reported dead in a tourist bus accident in Kenya. Efforts are underway to move the injured and deceased to Nairobi hospitals with the support of Loka Kerala Sabha and Norka Roots.

sports.headline: England complete 3-0 sweep after Duckett, Wood star in high-scoring 3rd T20IEngland completed a 3-0 whitewash over West Indies with a 37-run victory in the third T20I. Ben Duckett was adjudged Player of the Match for his brilliant innings of 84 (46) while Jos Buttler was adjudged Player of the Series.

WTC final preview: South Africa chase respect and glory against mighty AussiesWTC 2025 final preview: South Africa eye a defining triumph as they battle for respect on Test cricket's grandest stage. Standing in their way: defending champions Australia, chasing an era-defining victory at Lord's, London.

WTC final Australia vs South Africa: All the FAQs answeredSouth Africa and Australia head into the WTC Final with contrasting journeys but shared ambitions. As they meet at Lord's, it's a chance to settle scores and stake claim to Test cricket's biggest prize.

WTC final: Pat Cummins won't be surprised if English fans support South AfricaAustralia captain Pat Cummins said he anticipates the neutrals and a lot of English supporters to back South Africa in the World Test Championship final at Lord's, London.

Parth Jindal calls for new manager after India's unacceptable Hong Kong lossIndia's 0-1 defeat to Hong Kong in the Asian Cup Qualifiers has triggered fresh outrage, with Bengaluru FC owner Parth Jindal publicly calling for a managerial overhaul and urgent action from the All India Football Federation.

MS Dhoni, new ICC Hall of Famer, felicitated by Jharkhand cricket body in RanchiJharkhand State Cricket Association president, Ajay Nath Shahdeo, met MS Dhoni in person in Ranchi after the state body held a special ceremony to celebrate the former captain's induction into ICC Hall of Fame.

Pat Cummins explains Sam Konstas' snub from WTC Final: Has a long career aheadAustralia captain Pat Cummins assured that Sam Konstas' Test future still has a long way to pan out despite WTC Final exclusion. Marnus Labuschagne got nod to open against South Africa at Lord's over Konstas.

Rohan Bopanna out of top 50 for 1st time in 15 years, Nagal slips below 200Sumit Nagal is India's highest-ranked men's singles player, but he has dropped below 200 in the latest ATP rankings. Meanwhile, Rohan Bopanna, who was ranked No. 1 lat year, has dropped out of the top 50 for the first time since 2010 in men's doubles.

India lose 0-1 to Hong Kong as pressure rises on coach Manolo MarquezIndia head coach Manolo Marquez found the pressure on him and his future at the role rise as his side lost 1-0 to Hong Kong in their AFC Asian Cup Qualifiers clash on June 10, which only stretches their recent run of disastrous form.

How Kagiso Rabada regained Proteas dressing room's trust after drugs banSouth Africa captain Temba Bavuma said both the dressing room and Kagiso Rabada have moved on from the episode involving his drugs ban. Rabada will lead the Proteas' bowling attack in the World Test Championship final against Australia at Lord's, London.

MS Dhoni, new ICC Hall of Famer, felicitated by Jharkhand cricket body in RanchiJharkhand State Cricket Association president, Ajay Nath Shahdeo, met MS Dhoni in person in Ranchi after the state body held a special ceremony to celebrate the former captain's induction into ICC Hall of Fame.

Pat Cummins explains Sam Konstas' snub from WTC Final: Has a long career aheadAustralia captain Pat Cummins assured that Sam Konstas' Test future still has a long way to pan out despite WTC Final exclusion. Marnus Labuschagne got nod to open against South Africa at Lord's over Konstas.

Rohan Bopanna out of top 50 for 1st time in 15 years, Nagal slips below 200Sumit Nagal is India's highest-ranked men's singles player, but he has dropped below 200 in the latest ATP rankings. Meanwhile, Rohan Bopanna, who was ranked No. 1 lat year, has dropped out of the top 50 for the first time since 2010 in men's doubles.

India lose 0-1 to Hong Kong as pressure rises on coach Manolo MarquezIndia head coach Manolo Marquez found the pressure on him and his future at the role rise as his side lost 1-0 to Hong Kong in their AFC Asian Cup Qualifiers clash on June 10, which only stretches their recent run of disastrous form.

How Kagiso Rabada regained Proteas dressing room's trust after drugs banSouth Africa captain Temba Bavuma said both the dressing room and Kagiso Rabada have moved on from the episode involving his drugs ban. Rabada will lead the Proteas' bowling attack in the World Test Championship final against Australia at Lord's, London.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
